page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT.
page.content: {WORK IN KNOSSINGTON & OWSTON { ____________________________ { }Owston is an agricultural village with nineteen of its forty_five adults involved in farming. There are six farming families where the wives, and in two cases, the sons, are occupied on the farms and two of the other women in the village are involved with farming. No-one in the village employs another Owston resident but one farm employs two men from elsewhere. Other occupations include two teachers,two engineers, a solicitor, lorry_driver, industrial manager, catering supplier, educational consultant, wholesale stationer, radiographer, magistrate and motor_bike scrambler.Five people are self_employed and nine commute regularly, going to Leicester, Worcester, Grantham and London.
